resources.string: 1. It is impossible to use any other applications while blocking your device with Savage Blocker. Once the block has started, only answering phone calls through the notification bar is possible. You can only make emergency calls if your lock screen has the Emergency Call button enabled. The app has not been officially tested on wearable or tablet devices and may contain bugs in general.

2. If the block timer has not finished, the only way to unblock your device is by connecting the device via USB to a PC and using adb commands. This requires you to enable Developer Options and enable USB debugging as well as setting your default USB preference to File Transfer.

3. The app requires the \'Can Draw Overlays\' and \'Permit Usage Access\' permissions for the block overlay to function. The usage data will only be used by the app locally when the block is turned on. The app has zero analytics or telemetry.
4. Savage Blocker falls under the GPLv3 license. No liability caused by the misuse or malfunctioning of the Savage Blocker application shall be placed on the developer.
To change this permission, you must enable the \'Allow display over other apps\' in Settings > Apps
To change this permission, you must enable the \'Permit usage access\' in Settings > Apps
Can I end the block early?
This is only possible if you have enabled Developer Options, enabled USB debugging, and set the default USB preference to File Transfer
How can I end the block?
1. Download SDK Platform Tools from developer.android.com (Linux, Windows, or Mac)
2. Unzip the zip file into a folder
4. Type in cd \'PATH\', where \'PATH\' is the full path to the platform-tools folder
5. Connect your phone via USB and allow file transfer
6. Type in \'adb shell am force-stop com.pathfoss.savageblocker\' and press enter
7. Go to your phone Settings -> Apps -> Savage Blocker and clear storage
* If you manage to remove the block early by any other means, please create an issue on GitHub
